chunks.original_latin:
HAYMO HALBERSTATISCHEN EPISCOPUS
IN AMOS PROPHETAM.
chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
<speak>
    On the Prophet Amos<break time="500ms"/>
by Haymo of Halberstadt
<break time="1s"/>
</speak>

The Prophet Amos, whose name means "good," prophesied in Samaria and Jerusalem. He described the sins of the nations using the image of the whole world. He foretold the coming of Christ with the voice of the Lord, saying: "I make thunder, and create the Spirit, and announce Christ among humans." The rest of what he says about Amaziah and Jeroboam, or Israel, should be understood as referring to heretics.
chunks.original_latin:
Amos, qui interpretatur bonus, vaticinavit in
Samaria et Hierusalem, tria et quatuor scelera gentium
sub totius mundi imagine describens. Hic
adventum Christi sub Dominica voce ita praedicat:
 Ego firmans tonitruum, et creans Spiritum, et annuntians
in hominibus Christum. Reliqua autem quae
de Amasia et Hieroboam, sive Israel loquitur, tropologice
ad haereticos referenda sunt.
